channel.title: Eldrazi 728 - Learning project || applications
channel.description:
Hey, well as some of you may remember Eldrazi 604. I released it a year ago. Well i decided to remake it using Matrix. Yeah i know (Leech, N3RD, l2makeurownsource ect. ect.) but hey i don't think anyone makes there own source. Technically everyone who codes rsps leeched from moparisthebest, since he made the first if not one of the first private servers.
Moving on, I have been working on this server for a few weeks. But i found out i couldnt port forward anymore, my friend/partner is offering to pay for a dedi server next month. But i want the server to be perfect before we release :) This is where the applications come in, i want to learn more about Java and im pretty sure alot of you do aswell. But one of the first projects i was in didn't turn out all to good i was kicked for not knowing enough. Which is why i am doing this, you will have a chance to learn more and not be kicked because u won't actually be apart of a project until you prove yourself of being worthy :p
Want to apply? CLICK HERE <- Will finish tomorrow
updatelog: [code]updated cache to 728 [9/27/12] disabled auto ladder handler (from now on ladders will be added up front to prevent bugs)[9/28/12][/code]
MEDIA: New tokhaar-kal [img]http://puu.sh/19ciP[/img]
WEBSITE: [url=http://www.eldrazi.comeze.com]www.eldrazi.comeze.com[/url]
Anyways i will be finishing this thread and the application thread tomorrow or later tonight i have to go until then have a great day and check in later :)
-Jon

item.title: Eldrazi 728 - Learning project || applications
item.dc:creator: @Titandino Titandino
item.description:
@Titandino wrote:

arham 4:

Why not make the ladderhandler? Just put the stair ids in an enum and say for each enum id increase c.heightLevel.

What?.. He disabled it because currently in the Matrix source, you can click a ladder through a wall and go up a level because it literally just looks at the name of the object, checks if the name is ladder or stairs, and puts you up a level lol. Massive noclipping.

Your way of a ladder handler is over-complicating the problem.

Read full topic

item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:
